text: Vermont’s October unemployment rate (2.2%) was the lowest of any state.
Idaho and Maine had the largest increases in house prices between Q3 2018 and Q3 2019.
In October, average weekly earnings ranged from Mississippi's $745 to DC’s $1,589.
Florida and Hawaii saw the largest year-over-year increases in state GDP.
Utah’s job growth has exceeded the US average each month since April 2010.
Illinois's annual house price growth has trailed the US average each quarter since 2009.
Only Michigan saw private employment decline over the year.
Virginia was one of 18 states with a decade-low unemployment rate in October.
Over the year, state and local public employment increased the most in Colorado (2.3%).
Delaware's GDP growth rate fell below the nation’s growth rate for the first time since Q1 2012.
